clinical_study.brief_title: Safety And Tolerability Of Flexible Doses Of Oral Ziprasidone In Children And Adolescents With Bipolar I Disorder (Manic Or Mixed)
clinical_study.official_title: 26 Week Open Label Extension Study Evaluating The Safety And Tolerability Of Flexible Doses Of Oral Ziprasidone In Children And Adolescents With Bipolar I Disorder (Manic Or Mixed)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the safety and tolerability of ziprasidone during a long-term open label study in children and adolescents (ages 10-17) with Bipolar I Disorder (Manic or Mixed).

intervention.description: Oral ziprasidone capsules of 20 mg, 40 mg, 60 mg, and 80 mg strength will be provided. Subjects will be dosed daily for 26 weeks using a flexible dose design with a minimal dose range of 40mg twice a day (BID) to a maximum dose range of 80 mg BID. For subjects weighing <45 kg, the doses will range from 20 mg BID to 40 mg BID.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- The subjects must have received study medication in Study A1281196.
- In the investigator's opinion, the subject must be likely to continue to benefit from antipsychotic therapy and must have been free from any clinically significant safety concerns during the preceding double blind study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects who require treatment with drugs that are known to consistently prolong the QT interval.
- Subjects who are judged by the investigator as being at imminent risk of suicide.
